questions.questionText: Which Venn diagram best represents: Roses, Flowers, Plants?
options: Three concentric circles with Roses innermost
questions.explanation: All roses are flowers, and all flowers are plants. This means Roses ⊂ Flowers ⊂ Plants, represented by three concentric circles with roses in the center, flowers around it, and plants as the outermost circle.

questions.questionText: In a group of 60 people, 35 like tea, 28 like coffee, and 12 like both. How many like neither tea nor coffee?
questions.explanation: Only tea: 35 - 12 = 23. Only coffee: 28 - 12 = 16. Both: 12. Total liking at least one: 23 + 16 + 12 = 51. Neither: 60 - 51 = 9.

questions.questionText: Which Venn diagram best represents: Birds, Flying creatures, Penguins?
options: Penguins and Birds separate, both overlap with Flying
Penguins inside Birds, Birds overlap with Flying
questions.explanation: All penguins are birds (Penguins ⊂ Birds). Some birds fly, some don't (Birds overlap with Flying creatures). Penguins don't fly. So: Penguins inside Birds, and Birds circle overlaps with Flying creatures, but Penguins part doesn't overlap with Flying.

questions.questionText: In a class of 80 students, 50 play Cricket, 40 play Football, 30 play Hockey, 15 play Cricket and Football, 10 play Football and Hockey, 12 play Cricket and Hockey, and 5 play all three. How many play only Cricket?
questions.explanation: Only Cricket = Total Cricket - (C∩F only) - (C∩H only) - (all three) = 50 - (15-5) - (12-5) - 5 = 50 - 10 - 7 - 5 = 28.
